thread.title: Britain's youngest Euromillions winner labelled 'ungrateful cow' by This Morning viewers after moaning about her riches AGAIN
thread.title_full: Britain's youngest Euromillions winner labelled 'ungrateful cow' by This Morning viewers after moaning about her riches AGAIN

author: Vikki White
title: Britain's youngest Euromillions winner labelled 'ungrateful cow' by This Morning viewers after moaning about her riches AGAIN
text:
Britain's youngest Euromillions winner labeled 'ungrateful cow' by This Morning viewers after moaning about her riches AGAIN Jane Park was only 17 when she scooped £1million with her first-ever ticket Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Britain's youngest EuroMillions winner was blasted by This Morning viewers today after insisting her stupendous windfall has ­ruined her life. 
Jane Park, who was only 17 when she scooped £1million with her first-ever ticket, was on the ITV daytime show moaning about how lonely she is with all her money. 
Speaking to Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, she said: "I just think at 17 I was far too young." 
Jane - who has bought a Beetle, Range Rover and BMW car with her winnings - continued: "I moved into a property but I was just so lonely. (Photo: ITV) (Photo: ITV) (Photo: ITV) 
"Yeah, I have family but I'd just be sitting alone watching daytime TV in the flat." 
This Morning viewers weren't impressed with her, with one saying: "Woe is me. If it's that bad being a millionaire give it away you ungrateful cow. #ThisMorning." 
Another added: "Christ, that Jane Park is on tv yet again moaning about winning the lottery!! Give the money away and get on with your life #ThisMorning." 
A third agreed: "If money has made you so unhappy, what are you going to do with the fees for all your TV appearances? #thismorning #teenlottowinner." (Photo: ITV) (Photo: ITV) 
This isn't the first time Jane has hit out at Camelot for allowing her to win such a huge amount of money. 
Speaking on Loose Women, she previously said: "I never realised how difficult it would be. I thought everything would be amazing. 
"But, at times, it's completely different to how you’d expect." Jane Park on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) Jane Park on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) Jane Park on Loose Women (Photo: ITV) They asked her to give money to charity (Photo: ITV) 
Despite confessing she's no longer planning to sue Camelot, Loose Women viewers blasted her. 
One said: "Won a million and now complaining and wanting to sue camelot. Grow up. #LooseWomen." 
Another agreed: "This girl on # LooseWomen saying winning the lottery made her life a misery is a pea brain. Don't spend it all at once then you idiot." 
A third agreed: "She cant seriously expect the National Lottery to be held accountable for her lifestyle. This is ridiculous!" 
Jane, speaking in the same week she pleaded not guilty in her home city of Edinburgh to a charge of drink ­driving at a McDonald’s, said: “At times it feels like winning the lottery has ruined my life. Read More Jane says the win has ruined her life (Photo: Sunday Mirror) 
“I thought it would make it ten times better but it’s made it ten times worse. 
"I wish I had no money most days. I say to myself, ‘My life would be so much easier if I hadn’t won.’ 
“People look at me and think, ‘I wish I had her lifestyle, I wish I had her money.’ But they don’t realise the extent of my stress. 
“I have material things but apart from that my life is empty. What is my purpose in life?” 
Jane added: “I think 18 should be the minimum age for winning the ­lottery, at the least. The current age of 16 is far too young.”
